models.student module

module:

models.student

synopsis:

Student entity extending Person; manages course registrations.

This module defines the Student domain class used by the School Management System. A student has a validated/normalized ID and keeps a list of courses they are registered in. Helpers keep the student<->course relationship in sync.

Notes

  • Validation/normalization is delegated to src.validation.validators.

  • We keep “local” helpers (no recursion) to update each side intentionally.

  • __slots__ used to keep instances lightweight and catch typos.

class models.student.Student(name: str, age: int, email: str, student_id: str)[source]

Bases: Person

Student model; inherits name/age/email from Person and adds a student ID plus the list of registered courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Student’s name (validated in Person).

  • age (int) – Student’s age (validated in Person).

  • email (str) – Student’s email (validated in Person).

  • student_id (str) – External identifier for the student (validated, normalized).

student_id

Normalized student ID (via norm_id).

Type:

str

registered_courses

Courses this student is currently registered in.

Type:

list[Course]

Notes

  • Relationship maintenance tries to be simple and explicit.

classmethod from_dict(d: dict) → Student[source]

Construct a Student from a dictionary.

Parameters:

d (dict) – Dictionary containing at least name, age, email, and student_id.

Returns:

New Student instance (courses are not attached here).

Return type:

Student

Notes

  • Courses are intentionally not wired here; attach them later if needed.

list_registered_courses() → str[source]

Return a human-readable string of registered course IDs (also prints it).

Returns:

Message of the form: "The student <name> of id <student_id> is registered in the following courses: <ids>"

Return type:

str

Notes

  • Also prints the same message for quick manual checking.

  • If none, shows “no courses”.

register_course(course: Course) → None[source]

Register this student into a course and sync the inverse relation.

Parameters:

course (Course) – Course to register in (ignored if falsy).

Return type:

None

Notes

  • Prevents duplicates in registered_courses.

  • Ensures course.enrolled_students includes this student.

registered_courses: list['Course']
student_id
to_dict() → dict[source]

Serialize the student to a plain dictionary.

Returns:

Dict with person fields + student_id and registered_course_ids.

Return type:

dict

Notes

  • Related objects are represented by their IDs only.

unregister_course(course: Course) → None[source]

Unregister this student from a course and clean up the inverse link.

Parameters:

course (Course) – Course to remove.

Return type:

None
